name: Open Source Learning, Kauai's Sudbury School

posts.message: Open Source Learning is not currently in operation. For more information on Sudbury Schools or Free and Democratic education got to http://www.sudval.org/
The attributes listed as desirable for hiring are amazingly akin to the attributes acquired with a Sudbury education!
Last year at OSL students learned a lot about JC, the heart of the school, which also meant they learned a lot about fairness, equality, and personal and social responsibility.
Yesterday the "Lunch Room", "Toddler Room", "Game Room", and "Meeting Room" received their final cleanings.  It was wonderful to have one last pillow fort built with as much enthusiasm as ever!
Treating children with disrespect actually can impede their learning and conversely treating children with respect allows for higher intellegence to develop.
Sudbury schooling is not just "life" education for students; it's life learning for parents as well.
Game based learning... "I was blown away. I felt like I glimpsed a future in which kids love to learn. I imagined schools full of enthusiastic kids discovering that both life and work can be play."
Oh, the relevancy of compulsory education!?

comments.message: Ahhhhhh... Validation. Even Mimsy has a bit of trouble putting into words what our students are learning! She did it though & very eloquently... Please read!

comments.message: Ruben Castelein

posts.message:
"There is ample evidence that drug prices have been pushed to astronomical heights for no reason other than the desire of drug makers to maximize profits. Prices in many cases far exceed what’s needed to cover the costs of research and clinical trials, and some companies have found ways to rake in profits even without shouldering the cost of drug development." 

http://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/20/opinion/sunday/no-justification-for-high-drug-prices.html?_r=0

Open source pharma movement mentioned in this week’s issue of #TheEconomist!

"[Although there is] little sign yet of any improvement in the efficiency of drug research translating into cheaper medicines. The shareholders of a drugmaker expect it to charge as much as it can get away with; and since many drugs, for as long as their patent is in force, have no close competitors, the health systems and insurers they sell to may have little choice but to pay whatever they are asked for. [...] The open-source pharmaceuticals movement is experimenting with using prizes as an incentive for teams of volunteer scientists to work on new treatment approaches. Once invented and tested, the drugs would be free for any firm to make."


http://www.economist.com/news/business/21679203-high-cost-rd-used-explain-why-drugs-giants-merge-and-why-they-must-charge

 #drugdev #opensourcepharma #pharma

Vivid article by OSP2 attendee Jack Scannell on the fictions and truths of drug pricing and what can be done.


"The idea is to weaken, or even eliminate, the connection between pricing power and the size of the prize that companies receive for successful R&D. The idea is called “de-linkage.” In its most extreme form, an international consortium would offer large prospective prizes to drug companies for each new class of antibiotics; prizes up to $3.5 billion."

http://www.forbes.com/sites/matthewherper/2015/10/13/four-reasons-drugs-are-expensive-of-which-two-are-false/

We are pleased to announce Tata Trust's support for The Open Source Pharma Foundation. Press release is available as of today! http://srtt.org/news/events/open_source_pharma.htm
#OSP2 visits the StorkCafe in the town near Castle Rauischholzhausen after Day 2 of the conference and Brainstorming Breakout Session 1 yesterday evening.

The last day of #OSP2 in Castle Rauischholzhausen starts up with Ariel Lindner from Inserm speaking on how E. Coli can be used to treat TB: "All this is research is irrelevant without open collaboration." Get the most on this last day @OSPinfo

Day 2 begins with insightful presentation by Dr Jochen Maas from Sanofi Aventis on the relationship between pharmaceutical industry and academia. Each actor's 'currency' (e.g. patents from pharma and research from academia) can help the necessary cooperation between the two to create a new relationship where the patient receives better care and drugs. Follow it on Twitter with #OSP2 !

#OSP2 is now showcasing the traction that has developed over the last years including the growth of initiatives like Open Source Malaria and Open Source Pharma Foundation.
http://opensourcemalaria.org

The Second Annual Open Source Pharma Conference "Bringing it into Being" begins this morning with introductions, informative and insightful sessions, and brainstorming in Castle Rauischholzhausen, Germany. Follow and interact in the discussion on twitter with #OSP2 !

Turns out, #Ebola is transmitted through the air, but it's not very good at spreading through the airborne route. What in the heck does that mean? #NPR digs through studies and talks to scientists to find out.

An old two-story brick building, formerly a distribution center for Budweiser beer, is now the world’s most powerful factory for analyzing genes from people and viruses. And the virus detectives who work here are hot on the trail of Ebola and Lassa.

The New York Times: Yesterday, it was discovered that a second nurse who cared for Ebola victim Thomas Eric Duncan in a Texas hospital, Amber Joy Vinson, got infected. She then took a commercial flight from Dallas to Cleveland before showing signs of infection. And then she flew back. The debacle has prompted concerns about Ebola's other contagious threat: hysteria.
No profit incentive, no vaccine.

PBS: On Dec 6, 2013, the outbreak's first suspected victim, a 2-year-old Guinean boy living in a village, dies after four days of fever, vomiting and diarrhea. The boy's mother dies 10 days later, followed by his 3-year-old sister on Dec. 29, and his grandmother on New Year's Day. Over the next few weeks, a local nurse and a village midwife also die.

http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/pages/frontline/health-science-technology/ebola-outbreak/map-how-the-ebola-outbreak-spread-through-africa/

#Ebola #PBS

FasterCures: Develop a more efficient approach to clinical trials. One way to enhance patient participation in the research process is to make clinical trials more efficient. Without patients enrolling in clinical trials, the search for cures could slow to a snail’s pace. Clinical trials play a central role in scientiﬁc advances, yet recruiting patients into clinical trials, and keeping them in trials once they’ve signed on, continue to be a daunting challenge. 

http://www.fastercures.org/newsroom/public-comments/view/12

#pharma #healthcare

Wired: Over a 10-year period, 1,217 children and teens in the U.S. developed meningitis or encephalitis from a mosquito-borne infection; 24 were paralyzed; and 22 died.

http://www.wired.com/2014/09/ped-death-vector/all/1

#diseases #westnile #pharma

Q: Why has this particular Ebola outbreak become the worst on record?

MSF: One of the reasons is Ebola was not known in this part of Africa so it took longer to identify as the cause than it usually would have. You see now what’s happened in [the Democratic Republic of] Congo, immediately the samples were sent to test for Ebola. Ebola is a known disease in that area. But it took longer for people to consult and to identify this as a potential infectious disease [in West Africa].

http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/pages/frontline/health-science-technology/ebola-outbreak/msf-on-ebola-this-is-the-biggest-outbreak-weve-ever-known/

#MSF #DWB #Ebola

The Washington Post: Cochrane Collaboration researcher Tom Jefferson said that drug companies are often particularly unwilling to publish their raw data so that independent researches can reanalyze it: It took Cochrane Collaboration four years and a lawsuit to win the right to access data from clinical trials of Tamiflu from the drug’s manufacturer.

Un progetto della studentessa Irene Lanza e nel 2017 il software sarà open source. 
http://www.ilfattoquotidiano.it/2015/12/22/ridare-la-vista-ai-ciechi-grazie-a-un-suono-il-software-della-studentessa-di-reggio-emilia/2327059/

Ieri sera si è conclusa la Settimana Europea per la Riduzione del Rifiuto (SERR 2015) nella quale si sono recuperati ben 108Kg di hardware dai 170Kg iniziali, rigenerando 6 PC desktop con il FLOSS (free/libre open source software). 

Tutto ciò è stato possibile grazie all'idea progettuale "Officina Trashware" lanciata dall'Ass.ne Foreste Urbane (Copertino) in collaborazione con Ass.ne Salento Open Source (Racale) e MultiMedia Minds S.r.l. (Casarano). 

Il materiale informatico così ottenuto verrà utilizzato per la realizzazione di un laboratorio di informatica presso la sede del LUG Green Utopia di Copertino accessibile da persone bisognose ed economicamente svantaggiate, tentando in questo modo di colmare il divario digitale (digital divide), ossia la differenza di mezzi a disposizione tra chi è informaticamente alfabetizzato e chi ancora non lo è.

Ringraziamo in particolar modo Paola, Matteo e Gabriele di Foreste Urbane, Alessandro Medello di Multimedia Minds, il Dott. Luigi Aquaro (Legambiente P.to Cesareo), Antonio Franco (assessore all'ambiente di Copertino) e tutta la cittadinanza presente.
#SERR2015 #trashware #lugcopertino #dematerializzazione #domorewithless

Per coloro che ci tengono all'ambiente e vogliono capire come anche un vecchio PC invece di finire in discarica possa essere rimesso in funzione grazie anche al FLOSS (free/libre open source software), vi aspettiamo questa sera ore 19 a Copertino per presentarvi Officina Trashware. A dopo.

Podcast intervista a Foreste Urbane per l'iniziativa "Officina Trashware" (16'53"). Trasmissione "L'altra Europa" di Federico Taddia su Radio24| Il Sole 24 ORE.
Grazie ancora a tutti, vi aspettiamo al Laboratorio Urbano in via Montale ogni giorno dalle 16 alle 19. Buona Settimana Europea per la Riduzione dei Rifiuti a tutti. #SERR2015 #trashware

L' Associazione di Promozione Sociale "Foreste Urbane" vi invita a partecipare domenica 29 Novembre 2015, alle ore: 19:00, presso il LUG Green Utopia di Copertino in via E. Montale, all’incontro dedicato alla Settimana Europea per la Riduzione dei Rifiuti “SERR 2015 e RIDUZIONE DEI RIFIUTI. Il Trashware e l’importanza della rigenerazione”. Grazie all'intervento degli esperti di Associazione Opensource Salento, Multimediaminds Casarano e Legambiente di Porto Cesareo comprenderemo meglio la tematica del riuso, del riutilizzo e del riciclo di componenti elettronici.

In occasione della settimana europea per la riduzione dei rifiuti, Foreste Urbane e Salento Open Source/MultimediaMinds organizzano Officina Trashware presso il Lug di Copertino, dal 09 al 29 novembre 2015: rigenerare e riparare gratuitamente PC dismessi per donarli a chi non può permettersene uno. Maggiori info sulla pagina FB di Foreste Urbane

La Settimana Europea per la Riduzione dei Rifiuti (SERR) è un’iniziativa volta a promuovere la realizzazione di azioni di sensibilizzazione sulla riduzione dei rifiuti nel corso di una sola settimana. È  un’iniziativa che coinvolge una vasta gamma di pubblico: enti pubblici, imprese, società civile e cittadini.

La SERR consiste in una elaborata campagna di comunicazione ambientale che intende promuovere, tra i cittadini, una maggiore consapevolezza sulle eccessive quantità di rifiuti prodotti e sulla necessità di ridurli drasticamente. L’accento è quindi sulla prevenzione dei rifiuti e ogni azione della  Settimana Europea per la Riduzione dei Rifiuti mostra come ogni attore della società – compresi i singoli cittadini – possa, in modo creativo, contribuire a ridurre i rifiuti in prima persona e a comunicare questo messaggio d’azione agli altri.

In collaborazione con l'Associazione Foreste Ur1bane nasce l'iniziativa "OFFICINA TRASHWARE", all’interno della Settimana Europea per la Riduzione dei Rifiuti (21-29 Novembre 2015), permetterà di riparare, rigenerare e riutilizzare vecchi computer (fissi o portatili).

Invitiamo tutti i cittadini, le associazioni, le scuole, le parrocchie, i referenti di aziende pubbliche e private, di organizzazioni profit e no-profit, a recarsi presso il LUG, Laboratorio Urbano Giovanile di Copertino in via E. Montale (ex scuola materna Zona Spallanzani) dal 9 al 28 Novembre dalle ore 16:00 alle 19:00 per il conferimento dei propri pc usati.

I computer donati e rigenerati durante l’officina, allestita dal 21 al 28 Novembre presso il LUG e a cui tutti i giovani interessati al trashware possono partecipare gratuitamente insieme ai nostri tecnici informatici, e formandosi sul campo, verranno poi assegnati tramite bando di selezione ai bambini e ai ragazzi economicamente svantaggiati durante una cerimonia pubblica che si terrà la sera di Natale.

LA SFIDA: QUANTI KG DI MATERIALE ELETTRONICO NON UTILIZZATO RIUSCIREMO A RIPARARE E RIUTILIZZARE?

Lo scopriremo insieme Domenica 29 Novembre 2015, ore: 19:00, presso il LUG in via E. Montale durante l’incontro finale “SERR 2015 e RIDUZIONE DEI RIFIUTI.

Il Trashware e l’importanza della rigenerazione” a cui invitiamo tutti a partecipare.

Insieme alla presenza di esperti, comprenderemo meglio la tematica del riuso, del riutilizzo e del riciclo di componenti elettronici.
Per info e maggiori approfondimenti:
http://www.ewwr.eu/it (sito ufficiale SERR 2015)
http://www.ewwr.eu/actions/project/officina-trashware (link all’iniziativa)
foresteurbane@gmail.com / tel. 342 635 6214 funzionanti.

http://www.salentopensource.it/blog/50-settimana-europea-per-la-riduzione-dei-rifiuti-serr.html

Questa una delle differenze tra software proprietario e software libero, differenza non di poco conto che ha a che fare con la parola libertà!

Gli esperti di sicurezza hanno scoperto una vulnerabilità altamente minacciosa nel software preinstallato su alcuni computer Windows prodotti da Lenovo a gennaio 2015. Estrema negligenza da parte di Lenovo. 

La base del problema è Superfish che è stato progettato per interporre annunci durante la navigazione WEB degli utenti. Questo è irritante, ma c'è di peggio. Superfish installa anche un certificato che intercetta il traffico Web e paralizza la capacità del computer host per utilizzare HTTPS e per convalidare l'autenticità dei siti web. Ciò lascia una porta aperta che gli hacker possono utilizzare per interporre versioni falsificate di siti web - come siti Web delle banche - per rubare informazioni personali. Potete leggere di più la vulnerabilità ad Ars Technica.

Ogni volta che si utilizza il software proprietario, come Windows o Superfish, verificare la sicurezza e l'affidabilità è sempre difficile! Perché il codice proprietario non può essere ispezionato pubblicamente e non c'è modo per convalidare la sua sicurezza. 

Gli utenti hanno fiducia che il codice sia sicuro e che funzioni come da specifiche tecniche. Tenete presente che il codice proprietario può essere modificato solo dagli sviluppatori della software house proprietaria del software in questione, e gli utenti quindi, sono incapaci di scegliere il modo in cui sono fissati  i bug di sicurezza. Con il software proprietario, la sicurezza degli utenti è secondaria al controllo dello sviluppatore. NON FIDATEVI!

https://www.fsf.org/blogs/community/tell-lenovo-respect-user-freedom-and-prevent-future-superfishes

Easton LaChappelle. Ha 19 anni ed è il giovane maker statunitense che ha inventato la prima protesi del braccio open source, che non solo è azionata col pensiero, ma costa oltre cento volte meno delle protesi attualmente in circolazione.
http://wso2.com/landing/wso2-advantages/#100-precent-open-source

comments.message: http://windows.microsoft.com/it-it/windows/end-support-help

posts.message: Dal prossimo 8 aprile Microsoft smetterà di supportare Windows XP. Microsoft propone come soluzione il passaggio a Windows 7 o Windows 8.1, che sono impraticabili per chi ha un PC con qualche anno sulle spalle. Risulta importantissimo informare le persone sui rischi che corrono nel continuare a usare Windows (in particolare XP): rimanere in balia di virus e cracker, senza aggiornamenti di sicurezza per il proprio PC. Dall'8 aprile non verranno più erogati aggiornamenti di sistema, indispensabili per mantenere la piattaforma stabile e sicura, lasciando migliaia di persone esposte ad attacchi, disservizi, crash, furto e perdita di dati. Non farti trovare impreparato. Passa il prima possibile ad un sistema stabile, aggiornato e sicuro. Passa a Linux.

Open Source Software: uso prioritario nei pubblici uffici - Approvato dalla Commissione Bilancio Affari Costituzionali del Senato l'emendamento del Movimento che prevede l'uso prioritario di prodotti Open Source nelle Pubbliche Amministrazioni.

OST Solutions - Leading Software Development Company
Software Development Process

Our software development company offers business outsourcing and offshore support services in US, UK, Canada, Europe, Australia. It has expanded its horizons to bespoke software development, web solutions, business intelligence and automation. With clients in over 41countries, we advocate real certainty of success by working with partners who trust to provide their vision. We support our clients with expertise that will propel their business forward.

OpenSource is opening up tomorrow, Feb. 1st! Drop-in hours every Monday from 3 - 5:30 PM in rm 329. Come check out this second trailer, which features just some of the items you can do in OpenSource. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SymJxzE9Cc4

It's official -- OpenSource, the LHS MakerSpace is opening to the entire school with drop-in hours from 3 PM - 5:30 PM every Monday starting February 1st (this Monday!) in rm 329. Check out this trailer. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AQy_kkfx2cQ

Welcome to OpenSource! For our first page post, we'd like to introduce a series called Made in Lexington, in which we document various makers and projects in the community. 

This past weekend, we met with LHS Fishing Club admins Kenny Lamm & Zack Williams to talk about their experiences fishing and making their own equipment. They plan to use OpenSource to teach club members how to make their own lures and molds. How will you use OpenSource?

Coming January 2016.

posts.message:
OSVR is about to get full support for Vireio Perception v4.0. Vireio Perception are open source VR drivers that allow you to play existing games like Far Cry 3, Skyrim and Borderlands in a stereoscopic 3D format with head tracking recognition - opening up yet another library of titles to enjoy with the HDK and all OSVR supported headsets. Get ready to bring your favourite games to the next level. Full list of supported titles here: http://bit.ly/1JGVRex.

Don’t have a Hacker Development Kit yet? : http://bit.ly/1QZadFM

posts.message: As we usher in 2016 we’d like to reflect on how far we have come and thank everyone around us who is helping to make OSVR a success. With 19 headset developers, 110 game and content studios and a long list of peripheral partners on board covering motion tracking, locomotive and eye tracking technologies, we will continue to push the boundaries of VR technology in the new year to bring you more hardware and content options to enjoy VR on. Happy New Year!

We've done a count of the total number of OSVR industry partners we have to close the year with and we're at 300! That makes us the largest open source VR ecosystem in the industry! 2016 is going to be an exciting year for us as we work towards bringing you an ecosystem with multiple HMDs, peripherals and tons of gaming and media content. 

Find out more: http://bit.ly/1kugUVk

comments.message: Happy New Year "2016" OSVR Team - from New Zealand

posts.message: A very Merry Christmas to all of you! We stand on the verge of a virtual reality enabled future and can’t wait for the (fast approaching ) day it becomes tradition to celebrate Christmas in both reality and virtual reality. The holidays will never be the same again. How would you like to experience Christmas in VR?

Check them out: http://www.glowstickgames.com/
Get up to speed with the latest OSVR platform and partner updates through the newly released - 7th Dec OSVR Newsletter - http://bit.ly/1NHkz9S

posts.message:
The era of virtual reality technology has barely begun and already investors have poured nearly $4bn in to startups working on the technology. Check out this article from Fortune for more details: http://for.tn/1Im653a

We can only imagine how quickly the world will change once VR goes mainstream. Video conferencing, games, movies and things like live concerts are going to look very different in the future. What change are you looking forward to the most?

Catch up on the virtual reality revolution - past and present - through this great article based on research done by VR developer Greenlight and technology marketing research panel Touchstone.  

We are excited to be a part of this revolution, leading the charge on the open source front and paving the way for limitless device compatibility for no holds barred experiences with VR.

[Urgent] Suite aux événements tragiques survenus à Paris le 13 novembre dernier, le pôle Systematic Paris-Region & Tarsus France confirment que Paris Open Source Summit aura bien lieu les 18 & 19 novembre au DOCK PULLMANN.
 
Systematic & Tarsus mettront en œuvre les moyens de sécurité (fouille, contrôle d'accès et surveillance humaine renforcés) sur la manifestation avec éventuellement le concours des forces de Police afin d'assurer un contrôle maximum. Ces dispositifs seront maintenus tout au long de l’évènement.
 
L’équipe d’organisation se tient à votre disposition pour tout complément d’information contact@opensourcesummit.paris

Le programme de l'événement se dévoile peu à peu et cette semaine c'est Cédric Thomas, CEO OW2 et VP International, qui nous parle de la dimension internationale donnée à ce premier Paris Open Source Summit. 
Il nous dévoile notamment plus d'informations sur trois sessions: Community Summit, OSS in Big Cities et la carte blanche au pays invités que sont cette année la Chine et l'Espagne.

Pensez à vous inscrire ! (Inscription gratuite mais obligatoire)

http://bit.ly/1ONnYbF
Curious about the #OSSPARIS15 ? Our Program Team announced amazing keynote speakers today, check it out !

[Communiqué de Presse] Nouveau rendez-vous européen pour les professionnels de l’OPEN SOURCE !
 
Solutions Linux/Open Source et Open World Forum fusionnent pour créer le Paris Open Source Summit

1er évènement européen Libre et Open Source 
Les 18 et 19 novembre prochains aux Docks de Paris (La Plaine Saint-Denis) 
   
Paris / Palaiseau, le 29 mai 2015 – Systematic Paris-Region et Tarsus annoncent la fusion des salons Open World Forum et Solutions Linux/Open Source pour mobiliser la communauté européenne du Logiciel Libre et de l’Open Source autour d’un événement annuel unique, le Paris Open Source Summit. Présidé par Jean-Luc Beylat, président du Pôle Systematic, cet événement alliera la richesse de l’exposition et le savoir-faire business du salon Solutions Linux, à l’excellence des conférences de l’Open World Forum.
 
« Paris est une place forte de l’Open Source en Europe. Nous sommes ravis de co-organiser avec Tarsus ce nouveau rendez-vous qui offrira à l’ensemble de l’écosystème européen de l’Open Source – offreurs et utilisateurs – la possibilité d’échanger autour des dernières tendances et les enjeux du marché. Nous attendons 5000 visiteurs et 150 exposants et partenaires sur ces deux journées », indique Jean-Luc Beylat, Président de Systematic Paris Region et Président du Paris Open Source Summit.

« Tarsus est fier d’annoncer sa collaboration avec Systematic Paris-Region pour l’organisation de ce nouveau rendez-vous qui alliera les forces des deux événements majeurs sur le marché », ajoute Carole Jardon, Directrice du Pole IT de Tarsus France. 

Paris Open Source Summit affiche quatre ambitions majeures pour la filière du Libre et de l’Open Source en France :
● Promouvoir ses dimensions économique, technique et sociétale
● Générer des affaires pour ses entreprises
● Attirer les jeunes
● Promouvoir un territoire d’excellence
Paris Open Source Summit se positionne comme la vitrine de la filière du Libre et de l’Open Source francilienne et française, un lieu de convergence européen entre l’innovation Open Source, le business et les défis sociétaux d’une société numérique ouverte. Cet  évènement mobilise d’ores et déjà une partie de l’écosystème puisqu’il est co-organisé par des acteurs clés de la filière, Alter Way, Henix et Smile.

Veuillez d’ores et déjà noter dans vos agendas la tenue de l’événement les 18 et 19 novembre prochains. Le programme vous sera communiqué prochainement.

 
À propos de Systematic Paris-Region - www.systematic-paris-region.org - Sur Twitter @Pole_SYSTEMATIC :
Au cœur des infrastructures du numérique et des métiers du logiciel, le Pôle de compétitivité mondial Systematic Paris-Region fédère en Ile-de-France plus de 800 acteurs industriels, PME et scientifiques à la croisée de huit marchés technologiques à forte dimension sociétale (Transports, Energie, Télécoms, Sécurité, Santé, Ville  intelligente, Systèmes d’informations et Usine du futur) et de deux domaines technologiques (Logiciel Libre et Systèmes complexes).

Par le biais de neuf Groupes Thématiques, Systematic Paris-Region manage toute une communauté et déploie son expertise pour encourager l’innovation collaborative. A ce jour, Systematic Paris-Region a permis le développement de plus de 470 projets de R&D représentant  un effort de R&D global d’environ 2.5 milliards d’euros et un soutien cumulé de près de 850 millions d’euros provenant  de l’Etat, des agences ANR, EUREKA, FEDER, bpifrance et des collectivités territoriales.

Au-delà de la R&D collaborative, Systematic Paris-Region se fixe pour mission de développer un écosystème de croissance favorable au développement des PME en vue de leur  passage en « entreprises de taille intermédiaire » (ETI). Cet écosystème rassemble plus de 465 PME représentant  plus de 35 000 emplois dans les secteurs du Logiciel, des Systèmes, de l’Optique et de l’Electronique.

En matière d’attractivité, Systematic Paris-Region s’engage à promouvoir le territoire, le Pôle, la filière et ses  acteurs à l’étranger afin d’attirer compétences et entreprises, d’encourager et soutenir les actions exportatrices  des PME membres et d’insérer le Pôle et ses acteurs dans la dynamique européenne.

A propos de TARSUS France :
Tarsus France est un groupe média international, coté à la Bourse de Londres depuis sa création en 1998 et un acteur majeur spécialisé notamment dans l’organisation de salons professionnels traditionnels, pour la plupart reconnus sur leur secteur d’activités (Heavent, Stratégie Clients, EMarketing, Educatec-Educatice, Bureaux expo, …) et les salons Meetings (Heavent Meetings, IT Meetings, Marketing Meetings..). Il édite également des guides et des sites web professionnels.
 
Relations medias Systematic Paris-Region :

name: Fusion Ticket -  Open Source Box Office and Event Ticketing software

posts.message: New Release coming. Version RC3 is currently undergoing extensive pre-release testing by our VIP Donors prior to being made publicly available. Watch for details on http://fusionticket.org RC3 embodies many new features including a new look to the POS  and improvements to the ordering process by the use of 'Order Lines'. for tickets, discounts and miscellaneous products.

Are you a Registered User of Fusion Ticket promoting your Events using our Open Source Box Office and Event Ticketing software. You can now scan your bar coded tickets at the entrance to your Event using our new Mobile TicketScanner available from both the Apple Store (iOS) and Googleplay Store (Android).
Mobile TicketScanner is now available from Applestore (iOS) and Google Play (Android)
Both the Android and the iPhone versions of our Ticket Barcode Scanner have been released to our GoGo Donor Beta Testers and we await feedback.
We're doing initial tests on our IOS Mobile Ticket Scanner. Needs a few tweaks before we let it loose on our those who selected the GoGo reward to beta test a working release.

We're making good progress  with both the Mobile Phone Barcode Scanners and the Test Scripts that are currently being developed.  There should be an IoS version of the scanner available soon with the Android version following shortly afterwards.

It's been a busy month to date. Work on the Mobile Phone Ticket Scanner App is well underway and the Documentation and Test Scripts Project has been assigned. Work continues on bug testing of our 'Release Candidate' that will eventually take the software to a Production version.

Just a few days to reflect and enjoy time with our families after a hectic month then on with the work needed to fulfil the 'rewards' promised to the donators to our successful Crowd Funding Campaign. Hope you all enjoy a few days relaxation too!
Exciting times. We reached our target on our Crowd Funding campaign. Many thanks to all whose who donated and/or spread the word.

Less than 63 hours to go of our Crowd Funding Campaign. But we still need £588 to reach our target of £2500. Please help us over this final hurdle. Donate now at http://igg.me/at/Fusionticket and help ensure Fusion Ticket progresses to a Production release. Many 'rewards' on offer. Go on, do it, donate now.

We have made good progress in the last few days with our Crowd Funding Campaign http://igg.me/at/Fusionticket BUT we still have a long way to go and only a few days left. Please donate now and help us reach our target.

We have updated our Crowd Funding Campaign http://igg.me/at/Fusionticket with some additional images of our rewards. Please take a minute to look and support us in taking Fusion Ticket forward to production release.  Thankyou

How long is a piece of string?  An age old question to which  no one can really give an  answer, well at least  not without further data.  It's much the same with Open-source software. Because it's free to download how can you know how many people actually benefit from it?  Yes, you can record the number of downloads and the amount of feedback, good and bad, can give some indication. We thought that with well over 4000 registered members we would get a good response to our Crowd Funding Campaign aimed at adding a couple of new features and progressing to a formal release. But to date the response has been, frankly, underwhelming and we look in danger of not reaching our target.  So come on guys, help us make Fusion Ticket even more reliable and featured, it's in your interests to progress the project, we develop it for the Community.  Even a small contribution will help. So visit http://igg.me/at/Fusionticket and let's get to that target.  Please donate now.

Check out our Crowd Funding Campaign

(Event Ticketing On Line Box Office - Production release
Fusion Ticket Solutions Limited is a small Company developing an Open-Source Event Ticketing Web Shop and Box Office application. 

Our software is released under the umbrella of the GLPL v3 licence and hence is available for download and use without constraint. It provides all the functionality and features of a Box Office and On-line Web Shop and is aimed at individuals, small theatres and other Event Organisers.

We have launched an campaign to supplement the donations we receive from our current users to enable us to stringently test our latest release prior raising it to Production status and to add a much needed Mobile Phone Barcode Scanner.

Please visit http://igg.me/at/Fusionticket/x/5165115 to see our campaign.
New bug fixing releases of 7.1 (Community) and RC1 (Donorware) now available from the Downloads section at http://www.fusionticket.org
Support us with. our Crowd Funding Campaign to progress Fusionticket from Beta to Production. Details at http://igg.me/at/Fusionticket/x/5165005
New version (7.1b) now available for public download.  If you previously downloaded v7.1 then please update. Sorry for any inconvenience caused
We're moving forward. Release Candidate Version 1 (RC1) has been released for download by our VIP Donors. Check the Download tab on http://fusionticket.org

posts.message:
Congrats to Windsor and Maidenhead Symphony Orchestra (www.wmso.co.uk) on their 40th Anniversary.

Excellent Celebratory concert last night with a near full house. But could they have sold those few empty seats if they had an on-line Box Office? The extra selling channel may have filled the remaining few seats by raising awareness outside of their, obviously already very successful, existing marketing circle. Go on-line and see what it does for your Events. It's easier than you may think.

posts.message:
So your last Event was a great success. Go out and celebrate!
Will the next one be just as well or even better received? Will your next audience meet your expectations?

Too many event organizers rest on the glory of a well attended event without realizing that their next audience is very dependent on how the previous audience perceived the last Event.  Did you make them feel welcome? Did you communicate with them? Did you perform to the best of your ability?

Equally important, did you make it easy to contact you for details of any subsequent event? If so then they should return and you will, in time, build a regular audience.  Use one of the many (some free) organizations offering on-line Box Office and Web-shop Sales to maintain your customer details and help take the strain out of ticket selling.

It's difficult to persuade folk to attend Events in these times of economic austerity. Personal contact and local news media publicity can be the key to more ticket sales. However people now expect to be able to purchase and receive their tickets on-line. Maybe it won't fill the venue but at least you may sell a few more tickets and get valuable publicity. Visit http://fusionticket.com/ and get started with a free trial
Beta 7.1 now available for download from www.fusionticket.org. Faster page response and minor fig fixes

posts.message: Season's Greetings to all from the Fusion Ticket Team

The beta 7 release of Fusion Ticket seems to be very slow in responding to page requests. The Team are working hard to resolve the issue which appears to have been caused by an update of a 3rd party software component.  Hopefully it will be fixed soon

Do you have difficulty selling tickets for your Events?  Have you tried an on-line Box Office or Web-shop? If so, how difficult did you find it to set-up and administer? Did it help ticket sales?  Was it the success you hoped? Comments welcome

We've got some bad news guys. Open Source Merch is going on hiatus starting October 3, so get your orders in while you can! 

We may be back when the school rush settles down. And if you're REALLY craving some stickers after Oct 3, we've got some on the StickerMule Marketplace (http://www.stickermule.com/user/1070623409/stickers). 

Thank you so much for the support guys, and hopefully we can come back bigger than ever in the new year!

Hello new stock. Can you spot Larry? New stickers include HTML5 Badge, CSS3 Badge, Rails Emblem, and Larry the Gentoo Cow
3 new stickers! LLVM, C++, Ruby

First blog & video of an Open Source Awareness series. Topic this week? Vim Text Editor. Check it out it if you're interested.

https://medium.com/@OpenSourceMerch/open-source-awareness-a-brief-intro-to-vim-1a3461a470b8

It's come to my attention that there are people under the impression that I am doing this solely for profit and not in the spirit of open source. I encourage a dialogue and value transparency. Here's a blog post I wrote the other day about how I would like to contribute to the community (http://opensourcemerch.com/blogs/news/15524927-open-source-events). We launched on July 22 with the arrival of our first set of inventory. This is only 9 days ago! We've definitely put capital into this venture and would like to get that back in the future, but currently we're using the proceeds to increase stock, and then with the help of friends and supporters we want to put together a couple of events to introduce the public to the open source community and different open source softwares and projects. This project was created out of love for stickers and open source and I definitely want to share that with the world! I'm hoping that this will evolve into something bigger than just an online store where people can get stickers for their laptops.
Just letting everyone know that we've decided to ship worldwide now! Thank you to our international supporters for reaching out and letting us know!
Hey guys use the discount code LAUNCHPARTY for free standard shipping over $12.
